channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Markets get some much-needed relief as countries begin negotiating with Trump over tariffs
item.description: The Dow was up 1,300 points and the S&P 500 rose 3.7% Tuesday morning.

item.title: The Global Sell-Off
item.description: We explore the stock market panic over tariffs.

item.title: Trump advisors argue steep tariffs on countries like Vietnam and Cambodia are needed to erase trade deficits and rework supply chains. The economics say that’s going to be a long shot
item.description: Despite promises made by Southeast Asia governments, consumers in the region may not be able to afford American-made products.

item.title: Joe Manchin, the former Democrat criticized for often siding with Republicans, will release a memoir later this year called ‘Dead Center’
item.description: The former senator's book “Dead Center: In Defense of Common Sense” will be released Sept. 16.

item.title: Bill Gates’s daughter Phoebe knows she’s a ‘nepo baby’—that made her freshman year even tougher
item.description: Bill Gates's daughter Phoebe shared the scrutiny she felt she was under when starting at Stanford, and the fact her parents refused to let her drop ou...

item.title: Why I sold my family’s century-plus-old company to my employees
item.description: As business owners, we don't need the last nickel. We should be open to sharing some of the wealth.

item.title: An Explosive Clock Is Ticking on Iran and Its Nuclear Program
item.description: Expected talks between Iran and the United States would be a late, and perhaps last, opportunity to control Tehran’s nuclear ambitions and avoid war.

item.title: Global Stocks Recoup Some Losses Amid Trump Tariff Tensions
item.description: Stocks around the world recouped some of the losses set off by President Trump’s tariffs. China announced new measures to lift its markets.

item.title: Glenn Youngkin on D.E.I., Trump’s Tariffs and a Possible 2028 Run
item.description: In an interview, the Republican governor of Virginia spoke at length about his views on diversity efforts, among other subjects.

item.title: Pilots Discussed Alternate Ways to Land Before Deadly Jeju Air Crash
item.description: The pilots’ conversation with air traffic controllers, revealed in a partial transcript, could offer clues to what caused the disaster in South Korea,...

item.title: Dominican Republic Nightclub Roof Collapse: At Least 13 Killed
item.description: The authorities said search and rescue operations were continuing at the Jet Set nightclub in Santo Domingo, the capital.

item.title: Two Chinese Citizens Captured in Ukraine While Fighting for Russia, Zelensky Says
item.description: The Ukrainian president did not suggest that they had been sent by Beijing’s military, but he pointed to their presence as further evidence that Mosco...

item.title: Pilots Discussed Alternate Ways to Land Before Deadly Jeju Air Crash
item.description: The pilots’ conversation with air traffic controllers, revealed in a partial transcript, could offer clues to what caused the disaster in South Korea,...

item.title: Belgian Prince Seeks Pension Benefits
item.description: A court case by the Belgian king’s younger brother argued that he was entitled to a state pension to keep his wife and adult children financially safe...

item.title: An Explosive Clock Is Ticking on Iran and Its Nuclear Program
item.description: Expected talks between Iran and the United States would be a late, and perhaps last, opportunity to control Tehran’s nuclear ambitions and avoid war.
